property.name: block_cache_capacity_mb
property.description: block cache capacity in MB

property.name: builtin_ntp_servers
property.description: The NTP servers used by the built-in NTP client, in format <FQDN|IP>[:PORT]. These will only be used if the built-in NTP client is enabled (i.e. if setting --time_source=builtin).

property.name: time_source
property.description: The time source that HybridClock should use. Must be one of auto, builtin, system, system_unsync (toy clusters/testing only), mock (testing only). When set to auto, the system automatically picks one of the following depending on the environment: builtin, system, system_unsync, where in case of picking builtin the built-in NTP client is configured with dedicated NTP server(s) provided by the environment.

property.name: log_force_fsync_all
property.description: Whether the Log/WAL should explicitly call fsync() after each write.

property.name: fs_data_dirs
property.description: Comma-separated list of directories with data blocks. If this is not specified, fs_wal_dir will be used as the sole data block directory.

property.name: fs_metadata_dir
property.description: Directory with metadata. If this is not specified, for compatibility with Kudu 1.6 and below, Kudu will check the first entry of fs_data_dirs for metadata and use it as the metadata directory if any exists. If none exists, fs_wal_dir will be used as the metadata directory.

property.name: fs_wal_dir
property.description: Directory with write-ahead logs. If this is not specified, the program will not start. May be the same as fs_data_dirs

property.name: keytab_file
property.description: Path to the Kerberos Keytab file for this server. Specifying a keytab file will cause the server to kinit, and enable Kerberos to be used to authenticate RPC connections.

property.name: rpc_bind_addresses
property.description: Comma-separated list of addresses to bind to for RPC connections. Currently, ephemeral ports (i.e. port 0) are not allowed.

property.name: superuser_acl
property.description: The list of usernames to allow as super users, comma-separated. A '*' entry indicates that all authenticated users are allowed. If this is left unset or blank, the default behavior is that the identity of the daemon itself determines the superuser. If the daemon is logged in from a Keytab, then the local username from the Kerberos principal is used; otherwise, the local Unix username is used.

property.name: user_acl
property.description: The list of usernames who may access the cluster, comma-separated. A '*' entry indicates that all authenticated users are allowed.

property.name: webserver_certificate_file
property.description: The location of the debug webserver’s SSL certificate file, in PEM format. If empty, webserver SSL support is not enabled. If --webserver_private_key_file is set, this option must be set as well.

property.name: webserver_port
property.description: Port to bind to for the web server

property.name: webserver_private_key_file
property.description: The full path to the private key used as a counterpart to the public key contained in --webserver_certificate_file. If --webserver_certificate_file is set, this option must be set as well.

property.name: webserver_private_key_password_cmd
property.description: A Unix command whose output returns the password used to decrypt the Webserver’s certificate private key file specified in --webserver_private_key_file. If the PEM key file is not password-protected, this flag does not need to be set. Trailing whitespace will be trimmed before it is used to decrypt the private key

property.name: webserver_require_spnego
property.description: Require connections to the web server to authenticate via Kerberos using SPNEGO.

property.name: tserver_master_addrs
property.description: Comma separated addresses of the masters which the tablet server should connect to. The masters do not read this flag — configure the masters separately using 'rpc_bind_addresses'.

property.name: log_filename
property.description: Prefix of log filename - full path is <log_dir>/<log_filename>.[INFO|WARN|ERROR|FATAL]

property.name: maintenance_manager_num_threads
property.description: Size of the maintenance manager thread pool. For spinning disks, the number of threads should not be above the number of devices.

property.name: memory_limit_hard_bytes
property.description: Maximum amount of memory this daemon should use, in bytes. A value of 0 autosizes based on the total system memory. A value of -1 disables all memory limiting.

property.name: flagfile
property.description: load flags from file

property.name: help
property.description: show help on all flags [tip: all flags can have two dashes]

property.name: version
property.description: show version and build info and exit

property.name: colorlogtostderr
property.description: color messages logged to stderr (if supported by terminal)

property.name: log_dir
property.description: If specified, logfiles are written into this directory instead of the default logging directory.

property.name: logtostderr
property.description: log messages go to stderr instead of logfiles

property.name: max_log_size
property.description: approx. maximum log file size (in MB). A value of 0 will be silently overridden to 1.

property.name: tablet_history_max_age_sec
property.description: Number of seconds to retain tablet history, including history required to perform diff scans and incremental backups. Reads initiated at a snapshot that is older than this age will be rejected. To disable history removal, set to -1.

property.name: enable_process_lifetime_heap_profiling
property.description: Enables heap profiling for the lifetime of the process. Profile output will be stored in the directory specified by -heap_profile_path.

property.name: heap_profile_path
property.description: Output path to store heap profiles. If not set profiles are stored in /tmp/<lprocess-name>.<pid>.<n>.heap.

property.name: unlock_experimental_flags
property.description: Unlock flags marked as 'experimental'. These flags are not guaranteed to be maintained across releases of Kudu, and may enable features or behavior known to be unstable. Use at your own risk.

property.name: unlock_unsafe_flags
property.description: Unlock flags marked as 'unsafe'. These flags are not guaranteed to be maintained across releases of Kudu, and enable features or behavior known to be unsafe. Use at your own risk.

property.name: fromenv
property.description: set flags from the environment [use 'export FLAGS_flag1=value']

property.name: tryfromenv
property.description: set flags from the environment if present

property.name: undefok
property.description: comma-separated list of flag names that it is okay to specify on the command line even if the program does not define a flag with that name. IMPORTANT: flags in this list that have arguments MUST use the flag=value format

property.name: helpmatch
property.description: show help on modules whose name contains the specified substr

property.name: helpon
property.description: show help on the modules named by this flag value

property.name: helppackage
property.description: show help on all modules in the main package

property.name: helpshort
property.description: show help on only the main module for this program

property.name: helpxml
property.description: produce an xml version of help

property.name: log_link
property.description: Put additional links to the log files in this directory

property.name: log_prefix
property.description: Prepend the log prefix to the start of each log line

property.name: minloglevel
property.description: Messages logged at a lower level than this don’t actually get logged anywhere

property.name: stderrthreshold
property.description: log messages at or above this level are copied to stderr in addition to logfiles. This flag obsoletes --alsologtostderr.

property.name: stop_logging_if_full_disk
property.description: Stop attempting to log to disk if the disk is full.

property.name: symbolize_stacktrace
property.description: Symbolize the stack trace in the tombstone

property.name: v
property.description: Show all VLOG(m) messages for m ⇐ this. Overridable by --vmodule.

property.name: vmodule
property.description: per-module verbose level. Argument is a comma-separated list of <module name>=<log level>. <module name> is a glob pattern, matched against the filename base (that is, name ignoring .cc/.h./-inl.h). <log level> overrides any value given by --v.

property.name: block_cache_type
property.description: Which type of block cache to use for caching data. Valid choices are 'DRAM' or 'NVM'. DRAM, the default, caches data in regular memory. 'NVM' caches data in a memory-mapped file using the memkind library. To use 'NVM', libmemkind 1.8.0 or newer must be available on the system; otherwise Kudu will crash.

property.name: cfile_verify_checksums
property.description: Verify the checksum for each block on read if one exists

property.name: cfile_default_block_size
property.description: The default block size to use in cfiles

property.name: cfile_default_compression_codec
property.description: Default cfile block compression codec.

property.name: cfile_write_checksums
property.description: Write CRC32 checksums for each block

property.name: builtin_ntp_client_bind_address
property.description: Local address to bind client UDP socket used to send and receive NTP packets. The default value '0.0.0.0' is equivalent to '0.0.0.0:0' meaning 'bind to all available IPv4 interfaces using ephemeral ports (i.e. port 0)'. It might be useful to customize this flag if getting through a firewall to reach public NTP servers specified by --builtin_ntp_servers.

property.name: builtin_ntp_poll_interval_ms
property.description: The time between successive polls of a single NTP server (in milliseconds)

property.name: max_clock_sync_error_usec
property.description: Maximum allowed clock synchronization error as reported by NTP before the server will abort.

property.name: ntp_initial_sync_wait_secs
property.description: Amount of time in seconds to wait for clock synchronisation at startup. A value of zero means Kudu will fail to start if the clock is unsynchronized. This flag can prevent Kudu from crashing if it starts before NTP can synchronize the clock.

property.name: predicate_effectivess_enabled
property.description: Should ineffective predicate filtering be disabled

property.name: predicate_effectivess_num_skip_blocks
property.description: Number of blocks to skip for every predicate effectiveness check

property.name: predicate_effectivess_reject_ratio
property.description: Rejection ratio below which predicate filter is considered ineffective

property.name: cmeta_force_fsync
property.description: Whether fsync() should be called when consensus metadata files are updated

property.name: consensus_rpc_timeout_ms
property.description: Timeout used for all consensus internal RPC communications.

property.name: consensus_max_batch_size_bytes
property.description: The maximum per-tablet RPC batch size when updating peers.

property.name: follower_unavailable_considered_failed_sec
property.description: Seconds that a leader is unable to successfully heartbeat to a follower after which the follower is considered to be failed and evicted from the config.

property.name: fs_wal_dir_reserved_bytes
property.description: Number of bytes to reserve on the log directory filesystem for non-Kudu usage. The default, which is represented by -1, is that 1% of the disk space on each disk will be reserved. Any other value specified represents the number of bytes reserved and must be greater than or equal to 0. Explicit percentages to reserve are not currently supported

property.name: fs_wal_use_file_cache
property.description: Whether to use the server-wide file cache for WAL segments and WAL index chunks.

property.name: group_commit_queue_size_bytes
property.description: Maximum size of the group commit queue in bytes

property.name: log_min_segments_to_retain
property.description: The minimum number of past log segments to keep at all times, regardless of what is required for durability. Must be at least 1.

property.name: global_log_cache_size_limit_mb
property.description: Server-wide version of 'log_cache_size_limit_mb'. The total memory used for caching log entries across all tablets is kept under this threshold.

property.name: log_cache_size_limit_mb
property.description: The total per-tablet size of consensus entries which may be kept in memory. The log cache attempts to keep all entries which have not yet been replicated to all followers in memory, but if the total size of those entries exceeds this limit within an individual tablet, the oldest will be evicted.

property.name: log_async_preallocate_segments
property.description: Whether the WAL segments preallocation should happen asynchronously

property.name: log_preallocate_segments
property.description: Whether the WAL should preallocate the entire segment before writing to it

property.name: log_segment_size_mb
property.description: The default size for log segments, in MB

property.name: evict_failed_followers
property.description: Whether to evict followers from the Raft config that have fallen too far behind the leader’s log to catch up normally or have been unreachable by the leader for longer than follower_unavailable_considered_failed_sec

property.name: leader_failure_max_missed_heartbeat_periods
property.description: Maximum heartbeat periods that the leader can fail to heartbeat in before we consider the leader to be failed. The total failure timeout in milliseconds is raft_heartbeat_interval_ms times leader_failure_max_missed_heartbeat_periods. The value passed to this flag may be fractional.

property.name: raft_heartbeat_interval_ms
property.description: The heartbeat interval for Raft replication. The leader produces heartbeats to followers at this interval. The followers expect a heartbeat at this interval and consider a leader to have failed if it misses several in a row.

property.name: safe_time_advancement_without_writes
property.description: Whether to enable the advancement of "safe" time in the absense of write operations

property.name: fs_data_dirs_available_space_cache_seconds
property.description: Number of seconds we cache the available disk space in the block manager.

property.name: fs_data_dirs_consider_available_space
property.description: Whether to consider available space when selecting a data directory during tablet or data block creation.

property.name: fs_data_dirs_reserved_bytes
property.description: Number of bytes to reserve on each data directory filesystem for non-Kudu usage. The default, which is represented by -1, is that 1% of the disk space on each disk will be reserved. Any other value specified represents the number of bytes reserved and must be greater than or equal to 0. Explicit percentages to reserve are not currently supported

property.name: fs_max_thread_count_per_data_dir
property.description: Maximum work thread per data directory.

property.name: fs_target_data_dirs_per_tablet
property.description: Indicates the target number of data dirs to spread each tablet’s data across. If greater than the number of data dirs available, data will be striped across those available. A value of 0 indicates striping should occur across all healthy data dirs. Using fewer data dirs per tablet means a single drive failure will be less likely to affect a given tablet.

property.name: block_manager
property.description: Which block manager to use for storage. Valid options are 'file' and 'log'. The file block manager is not suitable for production use due to scaling limitations.

property.name: log_container_excess_space_before_cleanup_fraction
property.description: Additional fraction of a log container’s calculated size that must be consumed on disk before the container is considered to be inconsistent and subject to excess space cleanup at block manager startup.

property.name: log_container_max_blocks
property.description: Maximum number of blocks (soft) of a log container. Use 0 for no limit. Use -1 for no limit except in the case of a kernel bug with hole punching on ext4 (see KUDU-1508 for details).

property.name: log_container_max_size
property.description: Maximum size (soft) of a log container

property.name: log_container_preallocate_bytes
property.description: Number of bytes to preallocate in a log container when creating new blocks. Set to 0 to disable preallocation

property.name: server_thread_pool_max_thread_count
property.description: Maximum number of threads to allow in each server-wide thread pool. If -1, Kudu will automatically calculate this value. It is an error to use a value of 0.

property.name: rpc_acceptor_listen_backlog
property.description: Socket backlog parameter used when listening for RPC connections. This defines the maximum length to which the queue of pending TCP connections inbound to the RPC server may grow. If a connection request arrives when the queue is full, the client may receive an error. Higher values may help the server ride over bursts of new inbound connection requests.

property.name: rpc_encrypt_loopback_connections
property.description: Whether to encrypt data transfer on RPC connections that stay within a single host. Encryption here is likely to offer no additional security benefit since only a local 'root' user could intercept the traffic, and wire encryption does not suitably protect against such an attacker.

property.name: rpc_callback_max_cycles
property.description: The maximum number of cycles for which an RPC callback should be allowed to run without emitting a warning. (Advanced debugging option)

property.name: tcp_keepalive_probe_period_s
property.description: The duration in seconds after an outbound connection has gone idle before a TCP keepalive probe is sent to the peer. Set to 0 to disable TCP keepalive probes from being sent.

property.name: tcp_keepalive_retry_count
property.description: The maximum number of keepalive probes sent before declaring the remote end as dead. Effective only if --tcp_keepalive_probe_period_s is not 0.

property.name: tcp_keepalive_retry_period_s
property.description: The duration in seconds between successive keepalive probes from an outbound connection if the previous probes are not acknowledged. Effective only if --tcp_keepalive_probe_period_s is not 0.

property.name: remember_clients_ttl_ms
property.description: Maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, the server "remembers" a client for the purpose of caching its responses. After this period without hearing from it, the client is no longer remembered and the memory occupied by its responses is reclaimed. Retries of requests older than 'remember_clients_ttl_ms' are treated as new ones.

property.name: remember_responses_ttl_ms
property.description: Maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, the server "remembers" a response to a specific request for a client. After this period has elapsed, the response may have been garbage collected and the client might get a response indicating the request is STALE.

property.name: rpc_dump_all_traces
property.description: If true, dump all RPC traces at INFO level

property.name: rpc_duration_too_long_ms
property.description: Threshold (in milliseconds) above which a RPC is considered too long and its duration and method name are logged at INFO level. The time measured is between when a RPC is accepted and when its call handler completes.

property.name: trusted_subnets
property.description: A trusted subnet whitelist. If set explicitly, all unauthenticated or unencrypted connections are prohibited except the ones from the specified address blocks. Otherwise, private network (127.0.0.0/8, etc.) and local subnets of all local network interfaces will be used. Set it to '0.0.0.0/0' to allow unauthenticated/unencrypted connections from all remote IP addresses. However, if network access is not otherwise restricted by a firewall, malicious users may be able to gain unauthorized access.

property.name: rpc_max_message_size
property.description: The maximum size of a message that any RPC that the server will accept. Must be at least 1MB.

property.name: use_system_auth_to_local
property.description: When enabled, use the system krb5 library to map Kerberos principal names to local (short) usernames. If not enabled, the first component of the principal will be used as the short name. For example, 'kudu/foo.example.com@EXAMPLE' will map to 'kudu'.

property.name: metrics_default_level
property.description: The default severity level to use when filtering the metrics. Valid choices are 'debug', 'info', and 'warn'. The levels are ordered and lower levels include the levels above them. This value can be overridden by passing the level query parameter to the '/metrics' endpoint.

property.name: web_log_bytes
property.description: The maximum number of bytes to display on the debug webserver’s log page

property.name: rpc_advertised_addresses
property.description: Comma-separated list of addresses to advertise externally for RPC connections. Ephemeral ports (i.e. port 0) are not allowed. This should be configured when the locally bound RPC addresses specified in --rpc_bind_addresses are not externally resolvable, for example, if Kudu is deployed in a container.

property.name: rpc_num_acceptors_per_address
property.description: Number of RPC acceptor threads for each bound address

property.name: rpc_num_service_threads
property.description: Number of RPC worker threads to run

property.name: rpc_service_queue_length
property.description: Default length of queue for incoming RPC requests

property.name: gc_tcmalloc_memory_interval_seconds
property.description: Interval seconds to GC tcmalloc memory, 0 means disabled.

property.name: max_negotiation_threads
property.description: Maximum number of connection negotiation threads.

property.name: min_negotiation_threads
property.description: Minimum number of connection negotiation threads.

property.name: num_reactor_threads
property.description: Number of libev reactor threads to start.

property.name: rpc_authentication
property.description: Whether to require RPC connections to authenticate. Must be one of 'disabled', 'optional', or 'required'. If 'optional', authentication will be used when the remote end supports it. If 'required', connections which are not able to authenticate (because the remote end lacks support) are rejected. Secure clusters should use 'required'.

property.name: rpc_default_keepalive_time_ms
property.description: If an RPC connection from a client is idle for this amount of time, the server will disconnect the client. Setting this to any negative value keeps connections always alive.

property.name: rpc_encryption
property.description: Whether to require RPC connections to be encrypted. Must be one of 'disabled', 'optional', or 'required'. If 'optional', encryption will be used when the remote end supports it. If 'required', connections which are not able to use encryption (because the remote end lacks support) are rejected. If 'disabled', encryption will not be used, and RPC authentication (--rpc_authentication) must also be disabled as well. Secure clusters should use 'required'.

property.name: rpc_negotiation_timeout_ms
property.description: Timeout for negotiating an RPC connection.

property.name: rpc_private_key_password_cmd
property.description: A Unix command whose output returns the password used to decrypt the RPC server’s private key file specified in --rpc_private_key_file. If the .PEM key file is not password-protected, this flag does not need to be set. Trailing whitespace will be trimmed before it is used to decrypt the private key.

property.name: rpc_tls_ciphers
property.description: The cipher suite preferences to use for TLS-secured RPC connections. Uses the OpenSSL cipher preference list format. See man (1) ciphers for more information.

property.name: rpc_tls_min_protocol
property.description: The minimum protocol version to allow when for securing RPC connections with TLS. May be one of 'TLSv1', 'TLSv1.1', or 'TLSv1.2'.

property.name: server_max_open_files
property.description: Maximum number of open file descriptors. If 0, Kudu will automatically calculate this value. This is a soft limit

property.name: webserver_enabled
property.description: Whether to enable the web server on this daemon. NOTE: disabling the web server is also likely to prevent monitoring systems from properly capturing metrics.

property.name: metrics_log_interval_ms
property.description: Interval (in milliseconds) at which the server will dump its metrics to a local log file. The log files are located in the same directory as specified by the -log_dir flag. If this is not a positive value, then metrics logging will be disabled.

property.name: webserver_max_post_length_bytes
property.description: The maximum length of a POST request that will be accepted by the embedded web server.

property.name: webserver_x_frame_options
property.description: The webserver will add an 'X-Frame-Options' HTTP header with this value to all responses. This can help prevent clickjacking attacks.

property.name: webserver_advertised_addresses
property.description: Comma-separated list of addresses to advertise externally for HTTP(S) connections. Ephemeral ports (i.e. port 0) are not allowed. This should be configured when the locally bound webserver address specified in --webserver_interface and --webserver_port are not externally resolvable, for example, if Kudu is deployed in a container.

property.name: webserver_authentication_domain
property.description: Domain used for debug webserver authentication

property.name: webserver_doc_root
property.description: Files under <webserver_doc_root> are accessible via the debug webserver. Defaults to $KUDU_HOME/www, or if $KUDU_HOME is not set, disables the document root

property.name: webserver_enable_doc_root
property.description: If true, webserver may serve static files from the webserver_doc_root

property.name: webserver_interface
property.description: Interface to start debug webserver on. If blank, webserver binds to 0.0.0.0

property.name: webserver_num_worker_threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads to start for handling web server requests

property.name: webserver_password_file
property.description: (Optional) Location of .htpasswd file containing user names and hashed passwords for debug webserver authentication

property.name: webserver_tls_ciphers
property.description: The cipher suite preferences to use for webserver HTTPS connections. Uses the OpenSSL cipher preference list format. See man (1) ciphers for more information.

property.name: webserver_tls_min_protocol
property.description: The minimum protocol version to allow when for webserver HTTPS connections. May be one of 'TLSv1', 'TLSv1.1', or 'TLSv1.2'.

property.name: compaction_minimum_improvement
property.description: The minimum quality for a compaction to run. If a compaction does not improve the average height of DiskRowSets by at least this amount, the compaction will be considered ineligible.

property.name: tablet_transaction_memory_limit_mb
property.description: Maximum amount of memory that may be consumed by all in-flight ops belonging to a particular tablet. When this limit is reached, new ops will be rejected and clients will be forced to retry them. If -1, op memory tracking is disabled.

property.name: tablet_bloom_block_size
property.description: Block size of the bloom filters used for tablet keys.

property.name: tablet_bloom_target_fp_rate
property.description: Target false-positive rate (between 0 and 1) to size tablet key bloom filters. A lower false positive rate may reduce the number of disk seeks required in heavy insert workloads, at the expense of more space and RAM required for bloom filters.

property.name: enable_deleted_rowset_gc
property.description: Whether to enable garbage collection of fully deleted rowsets. Disabling deleted rowset garbage collection may increase disk space usage for workloads that involve a high number of deletes. Only deleted rowsets that are entirely considered ancient history (see --tablet_history_max_age_sec) are deleted.

property.name: undo_delta_block_gc_init_budget_millis
property.description: The maximum number of milliseconds we will spend initializing UNDO delta blocks per invocation of UndoDeltaBlockGCOp. Existing delta blocks must be initialized once per process startup to determine when they can be deleted.

property.name: heartbeat_incompatible_replica_management_is_fatal
property.description: Whether incompatible replica management schemes or unsupported PREPARE_REPLACEMENT_BEFORE_EVICTION feature flag by master are fatal

property.name: heartbeat_interval_ms
property.description: Interval at which the TS heartbeats to the master.

property.name: heartbeat_max_failures_before_backoff
property.description: Maximum number of consecutive heartbeat failures until the Tablet Server backs off to the normal heartbeat interval, rather than retrying.

property.name: heartbeat_rpc_timeout_ms
property.description: Timeout used for the TS→Master heartbeat RPCs.

property.name: scanner_ttl_ms
property.description: Number of milliseconds of inactivity allowed for a scannerbefore it may be expired

property.name: tablet_copy_begin_session_timeout_ms
property.description: Tablet server RPC client timeout for BeginTabletCopySession calls. Also used for EndTabletCopySession calls.

property.name: tablet_copy_idle_timeout_sec
property.description: Amount of time without activity before a tablet copy session will expire, in seconds

property.name: tablet_apply_pool_overload_threshold_ms
property.description: The threshold for the queue time of the 'apply' thread pool to enter and exit overloaded state. Once the queue stalls and its queue times become longer than the specified threshold, it enters the overloaded state. Tablet server rejects incoming write requests with some probability when its apply queue is overloaded. The longer the apply queue stays overloaded, the greater the probability of the rejection. In addition, the more row operations a write request has, the greater the probablity of the rejection. The apply queue exits the overloaded state when queue times drop below the specified threshold. Set this flag to 0 to disable the behavior described above.

property.name: scanner_batch_size_rows
property.description: The number of rows to batch for servicing scan requests.

property.name: scanner_default_batch_size_bytes
property.description: The default size for batches of scan results

property.name: scanner_max_batch_size_bytes
property.description: The maximum batch size that a client may request for scan results.

property.name: scanner_max_wait_ms
property.description: The maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) we’ll hang a scanner thread waiting for safe time to advance or ops to commit, even if its deadline allows waiting longer.

property.name: tserver_enforce_access_control
property.description: If set, the server will apply fine-grained access control rules to client RPCs.

property.name: num_tablets_to_copy_simultaneously
property.description: Number of threads available to copy tablets from remote servers.

property.name: num_tablets_to_delete_simultaneously
property.description: Number of threads available to delete tablets. If this is set to 0 (the default), then the number of delete threads will be set based on the number of data directories. If the data directories are on some very fast storage device such as SSD or a RAID array, it may make sense to manually tune this.

property.name: num_tablets_to_open_simultaneously
property.description: Number of threads available to open tablets during startup. If this is set to 0 (the default), then the number of bootstrap threads will be set based on the number of data directories. If the data directories are on some very fast storage device such as SSD or a RAID array, it may make sense to manually tune this.

property.name: tablet_state_walk_min_period_ms
property.description: Minimum amount of time in milliseconds between walks of the tablet map to update tablet state counts.

property.name: update_tablet_stats_interval_ms
property.description: Interval at which the tablet statistics should be updated.Should be greater than 'heartbeat_interval_ms'

property.name: cloud_aws_instance_id_url
property.description: The URL to fetch the identifier of an AWS instance

property.name: cloud_aws_ntp_server
property.description: IP address/FQDN of the internal NTP server to use from within an AWS instance

property.name: cloud_azure_instance_id_url
property.description: The URL to fetch the identifier of an Azure instance

property.name: cloud_gce_instance_id_url
property.description: The URL to fetch the identifier of a GCE instance

property.name: cloud_gce_ntp_server
property.description: IP address/FQDN of the internal NTP server to use from within a GCE instance

property.name: cloud_metadata_server_request_timeout_ms
property.description: Timeout for HTTP/HTTPS requests to the instance metadata server (in milliseconds)

property.name: cloud_openstack_metadata_url
property.description: The URL to fetch metadata of an OpenStack instance via Nova metadata service. OpenStack Nova metadata server does not provide a separate URL to fetch instance UUID, at least with 12.0.0 (Liberty) release.

property.name: env_use_fsync
property.description: Use fsync(2) instead of fdatasync(2) for synchronizing dirty data to disk.

property.name: file_cache_expiry_period_ms
property.description: Period of time (in ms) between removing expired file cache descriptors

property.name: disable_core_dumps
property.description: Disable core dumps when this process crashes.

property.name: redact
property.description: Comma-separated list that controls redaction context. Supported options are 'all','log', and 'none'. If 'all' is specified, sensitive data (sensitive configuration flags and row data) will be redacted from the web UI as well as glog and error messages. If 'log' is specified, sensitive data will only be redacted from glog and error messages. If 'none' is specified, no redaction will occur.

property.name: umask
property.description: The umask that will be used when creating files and directories. Permissions of top-level data directories will also be modified at start-up to conform to the given umask. Changing this value may enable unauthorized local users to read or modify data stored by Kudu.

property.name: metrics_retirement_age_ms
property.description: The minimum number of milliseconds a metric will be kept for after it is no longer active. (Advanced option)

property.name: enable_minidumps
property.description: Whether to enable minidump generation upon process crash or SIGUSR1. Currently only supported on Linux systems.

property.name: max_minidumps
property.description: Maximum number of minidump files to keep per daemon. Older files are removed first. Set to 0 to keep all minidump files.

property.name: minidump_path
property.description: Directory to write minidump files to. This can be either an absolute path or a path relative to --log_dir. Each daemon will create an additional sub-directory to prevent naming conflicts and to make it easier to identify a crashing daemon. Minidump files contain crash-related information in a compressed format. Minidumps will be written when a daemon exits unexpectedly, for example on an unhandled exception or signal, or when a SIGUSR1 signal is sent to the process. Cannot be set to an empty value.

property.name: minidump_size_limit_hint_kb
property.description: Size limit hint for minidump files in KB. If a minidump exceeds this value, then breakpad will reduce the stack memory it collects for each thread from 8KB to 2KB. However it will always include the full stack memory for the first 20 threads, including the thread that crashed.

property.name: dns_resolver_cache_capacity_mb
property.description: Capacity of DNS resolver cache, in MiBytes. For each key, the cache stores records returned by getaddrinfo(). A value of 0 means the results of DNS name resolution are not cached.

property.name: dns_resolver_cache_ttl_sec
property.description: TTL of records in the DNS resolver cache, in seconds.

property.name: dns_resolver_max_threads_num
property.description: The maximum number of threads to use for async DNS resolution

property.name: nvm_cache_path
property.description: The path at which the NVM cache will try to allocate its memory. This can be a tmpfs or ramfs for testing purposes.

property.name: nvm_cache_usage_ratio
property.description: A ratio to set the usage of nvm cache. The charge of an item in the nvm cache is equal to the results of memkind_malloc_usable_size multiplied by the ratio.

property.name: memory_limit_soft_percentage
property.description: Percentage of the hard memory limit that this daemon may consume before memory throttling of writes begins. The greater the excess, the higher the chance of throttling. In general, a lower soft limit leads to smoother write latencies but decreased throughput, and vice versa for a higher soft limit.

property.name: memory_limit_warn_threshold_percentage
property.description: Percentage of the hard memory limit that this daemon may consume before WARNING level messages are periodically logged.

property.name: memory_pressure_percentage
property.description: Percentage of the hard memory limit that this daemon may consume before flushing of in-memory data becomes prioritized.

property.name: tcmalloc_max_free_bytes_percentage
property.description: Maximum percentage of the RSS that tcmalloc is allowed to use for reserved but unallocated memory.

property.name: drop_log_memory
property.description: Drop in-memory buffers of log contents. Logs can grow very quickly and they are rarely read before they need to be evicted from memory. Instead, drop them from memory as soon as they are flushed to disk.

property.name: log_backtrace_at
property.description: Emit a backtrace when logging at file:linenum.

property.name: logbuflevel
property.description: Buffer log messages logged at this level or lower (-1 means don’t buffer; 0 means buffer INFO only; …​)

property.name: logbufsecs
property.description: Buffer log messages for at most this many seconds

property.name: logfile_mode
property.description: Log file mode/permissions.
